__e: With luck, the best you can hope for is 20 years.
After all this time, to keep hoping, thinking if I care about him, maybe at some point I cared about you.
You can't just come here and say you're sorry and expect me to go running back home.
When they do, I'd like to think you'll still be here.
24 hours a day, I live with this aching possibility that you might call me to do something.
Since you called, I've actually had moments where I found myself wishing you were dead.
I've spent a lot of the past week... fantasizing about you guys breaking up, but now I just feel terrible for you.
Should we expect you to resolve this or is it over?
I guess it would be too much to hope that you two are finished.
Maybe that's because i keep hoping If i say something enough, you'll finally hear me.
Those are the times you just have to trust your team, and hope everything goes right.
The hope is, the time you two spent in here has helped you understand just what you've done.
But, hey, you know, you can always hope for a miracle, right?
And when you shot Violet you actually saved my life twice because sitting here with you right now this is the first time I've been able to see any kind of future for myself in a really long time.
Should I be hoping for a good night kiss?
But you can't see a ghost and still hope to find her alive. Both things can't be true.
Well then, you better hope she doesn't find you first.
I don't know if you want to find nothing and hope that she's somewhere still, um... alive.
Look, I know it sounds nuts, but I just keep hoping that there's some trace of us, of me.
But when you got a police officer that witnessed it... you expect that they would know a little more than she knew.
All I can do is hope that there is one small piece of his mind tucked away someplace safe.
I just think that you shouldn't get your hopes up, that's all.
I suppose you can hope to make some difference but what kind of diffenece have I made?
All that we can hope for is that your friend, your son, did not die in vain.
